# Task

Write a function `wrap_string`. It iterates over words and it will add a new line each time a maximum `text_width::Int=10` would be exceeded. Provide an example



# Data

wrap_string("This function will wrap words into lines")

```julia
function wrap_string(text, text_width=10)
    wrapped_lines = []
    
    for word in split(text, " ")
        line_length = length(word) + 2  # adding spaces before and after the word
        
        if line_length <= text_width
            wrapped_lines[end] += " $word"  # add word to current line
        else
            wrapped_lines.append("\n" * (text_width - line_length) / 2 + " $word")  # start new line with adjusted width
        end
    end
    
    return join(wrapped_lines, "\n"))
end

# Example
wrap_string("This function will wrap words into lines", 15)
```
The `wrap_string` function takes a text and an optional `text_width` as input. It iterates over each word in the text, checking if adding it to the current line would exceed the given `text_width`. If exceeded, a new line is started with adjusted width.

The example provided wraps words into lines up to 15 characters wide:

You can see that each time the line would exceed 15 characters, a new line is started.
